name: Beekman Tower Hotel

reviews.title: comfortable stay
reviews.text: My husband daughter [18] and myself spent 6 nights at the Beekman. We had a great time in New York. The Beekman Tower was ideal for us as our daughter had her own room. The staff are friendly and helpful [when we had a problem with the air conditioning help was prompt and efficient].

reviews.title: great return stay
reviews.text: We all loved the Radio City Music Hall Tour, and arranged prior to our visit a meeting with a Big Apple greeter which was informative, interesting and a good way to familiarise ourselves with the subway.

reviews.title: Good choice
reviews.text: Returned to the beekman for the second time this year, same super service, got upgrade to super suite on 21 floor, staff super as ever nothing to much trouble, shop around there are some great rates around for this hotel so have look around.

reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.text: We recently stayed a week at the Beekman Towers. We had a great time and would recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: First Class Hotel
reviews.text: We arrived early, stored our luggage and went to a local street fair for a few hours. Upon our return we checked into a one bedroom suite on an upper floor. The rooms were large, more like an apartment than a NYC hotel. We had a separate bedroom with a tv in a large armoire, a full bath off the bedroom with bathtub and excellent water pressure, a living room with another tv and comfortable pull out sofa bed, and a full kitchen with full size refrigerator, range, microwave, toaster and all kitchen utensils. Our rooms were very clean, although a little beaten up (there was some peeling wallpaper on one of the walls and the edges of the sofa were a little ratty). Two minor concerns, neither of which affected our enjoyment of the room or the hotel,. A person sleeping in the living room on the sofa bed would need to go into the bedroom to use the bathroom. Also, there were no dressers or clothing storage areas in the living room except for a closet to hang clothes and that foldable rack to hold an open suitcase.

reviews.title: Great stay
reviews.text: This hotel was the perfect haven during our hectic week-long tourist break in New York. The rooms were quiet, spacious and clean. We had a studio suite with a double bed and our teenage children had a twin room. There was some confusion over the rooms when we arrived but this was quickly sorted by the excellent front desk staff.

reviews.title: Great hotel good location
reviews.text: The location is ideal: it's in a pleasant, mainly residential neighbourhood but close enough to all the main attractions (although the nearest subway is not close if that's important to you). If you want a big, bold, brash hotel in the middle of New York then don't stay here. If you want somewhere comfortable and relaxing with bigger than average rooms then you can't go wrong here!

reviews.title: Couldn't have asked for more....
reviews.text: My family and I stayed at this hotel while celebrating our 10 year anniversary, I had emailed the staff and they gave us a complimentary box of choccis and bubbly. The staff were very friendly and when our case got lost in transit they were very helpful. the view from the top resturaunt was out of this world but not very child friendly menu so we had a couple of drinks as recommended by others and ate elsewhere. the location was next to one of the trolley tour stops so it was helpful for us to get around although a brisk walk took us to Central Terminal and Empire State. Fantastis city for couple singles and families we will return

reviews.title: Grat experience!
reviews.text: Staff were extrememly helpful in every way - they organised a taxi to the airport for us, stowed our luggage unitl we neded it, made us a glorious picnic basket, advised us where to eat - wonderful food in Angelo's !!

reviews.title: We loved it!
reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the Beekman in June 2005 duting the heatwave. The hotel was cool throughout it all. The suite was very clean if not a little dated. The bed was extremely comfortable and they offer several pillow varieties from which to choose.

reviews.title: Old
reviews.text: Our suite was on the 22nd floor and we had a small patio area and could see the East River and the Empire State Bldg.. Staff was very accomodating and we liked the location.

reviews.title: Beekman Towers: Very Nice Stay
reviews.text: It was very safe and not too far from bus or cabs. (Although on a regular workday don't expect to get a cab between 4-8pm and if you do get a cab, don't expect to move very quickly). It just wasn't that far to Grand Central Terminal -- afterall, you are in New York City and you will be walking.

reviews.title: Trust Your Fellow Reviewers
reviews.text: There is a groc /deli across the street and the Nations Cafe across the street that we highly reccommend for breakfast. It is a better value than the continental breakfast at the hotel.

reviews.title: Excellent choice.
reviews.text: We ate at the Top of the Tower and it was great food, but not family friendly. Our kids did not want the full selection included for the meal and they adjusted our bill accordingly.

reviews.title: Clean rooms, excellent professional service
reviews.text: Stayed at the Beekman for 6 days April/May 2005. Good welcoming by helpful staff, initially disappointed with low floor accommodation as had asked for high room but more than compensated by good facilities and an excellent sized room- more an apartment! Amazingly helpful staff when any small problem arose, nothing was too much trouble.

reviews.title: Pretty Art Deco but a little out of the way
reviews.text: Views were magnificent from the top of the tower bar, probably the best in Manhattan at night, although the cocktails and food were rather expensive.

description: The Beekman Tower Hotel is conveniently located in Manhattan’s distinguished mid-town east side, situated in the middle of the Beekman, Sutton and United Nations neighborhoods. The hotel is near all transportation as well as being right off the FDR Drive. This all suite hotel boasts New York’s largest guest rooms, fully equipped kitchens and living rooms with sofa beds, with breathtaking city and river views. The hotel is ideal for long stays.
